snippet: The director of the Princeton University Art Museum said the current show featuring oil sketches by John Constable is an attempt to “re-radicalize” Constable for 21st-century viewers.
abstract: Martha Schwendener reviews paintings by John Constable at the Princeton University Art Museum (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: The director of the Princeton University Art Museum said the current show featuring oil sketches by John Constable is an attempt to “re-radicalize” Constable for 21st-century viewers.

headline.seo: A Review of ‘John Constable: Oil Sketches From the Victoria and Albert Museum’
headline.main: Radical to Mundane, and to Radical Again
headline.print_headline: Radical to Mundane, And to Radical Again
